AddLatency.description: A dummy plugin that delays input audio for the given number of samples before passing it back to the output. Used internally to test Pedalboard's automatic latency compensation.

samples.description: Number of samples to delay the audio by

Bitcrush.description: A plugin that reduces the signal to a given bit depth, giving the audio a lo-fi, digitized sound. Floating-point bit depths are supported.

bit_depth.description: The bit depth to quantize the signal to

Chain.description: Run zero or more plugins as a plugin. Useful when used with the Mix plugin.

plugins.description: List of plugins to chain together

Chorus.description: A basic chorus effect that can be controlled via the speed and depth of the LFO controlling the frequency response, a mix control, a feedback control, and the centre delay of the modulation.

rate_hz.description: The speed of the chorus effect's low-frequency oscillator (LFO), in Hertz

depth.description: The depth of the chorus effect

centre_delay_ms.description: The centre delay of the modulation in milliseconds

feedback.description: The feedback amount for the chorus effect

Clipping.description: A distortion plugin that adds hard distortion to the signal by clipping the signal at the provided threshold (in decibels).

threshold_db.description: The threshold in decibels at which to clip the signal

Compressor.description: A dynamic range compressor, used to reduce the volume of loud sounds and 'compress' the loudness of the signal.

threshold_db.description: The threshold in decibels above which compression starts

Convolution.description: An audio convolution, suitable for things like speaker simulation or reverb modeling. The convolution impulse response can be specified either by filename or as a 32-bit floating point NumPy array.

impulse_response_filename.description: Path to the impulse response audio file

sample_rate.description: Sample rate of the impulse response (required when passing numpy array)

Delay.description: A digital delay plugin with controllable delay time, feedback percentage, and dry/wet mix.

Distortion.description: A distortion effect, which applies a non-linear (tanh, or hyperbolic tangent) waveshaping function to apply harmonically pleasing distortion to a signal.

Gain.description: A gain plugin that increases or decreases the volume of a signal by amplifying or attenuating it by the provided value (in decibels).

GSMFullRateCompressor.description: An audio degradation/compression plugin that applies the GSM 'Full Rate' compression algorithm to emulate the sound of a 2G cellular phone connection.

quality.description: The quality of the resampling algorithm

HighpassFilter.description: Apply a first-order high-pass filter with a roll-off of 6dB/octave. The cutoff frequency will be attenuated by -3dB and lower frequencies will be attenuated by a further 6dB per octave.

Invert.description: Flip the polarity of the signal. This effect is not audible on its own and takes no parameters. This effect is mathematically identical to def invert(x): return -x.

Limiter.description: A simple limiter with standard threshold and release time controls, featuring two compressors and a hard clipper at 0 dB.

LowpassFilter.description: Apply a first-order low-pass filter with a roll-off of 6dB/octave. The cutoff frequency will be attenuated by -3dB.

Mix.description: A utility plugin that allows running other plugins in parallel. All plugins provided will be mixed equally.

plugins.description: List of plugins to run in parallel

MP3Compressor.description: An MP3 compressor plugin that runs the LAME MP3 encoder in real-time to add compression artifacts to the audio stream. Currently only supports variable bit-rate mode (VBR) and accepts a floating-point VBR quality value (between 0.0 and 10.0; lower is better).

vbr_quality.description: Variable bit rate quality (lower is better)

NoiseGate.description: A simple noise gate with standard threshold, ratio, attack time and release time controls. Can be used as an expander if the ratio is low.

Phaser.description: A 6 stage phaser that modulates first order all-pass filters to create sweeping notches in the magnitude frequency response. This audio effect can be controlled with standard phaser parameters: the speed and depth of the LFO controlling the frequency response, a mix control, a feedback control, and the centre frequency of the modulation.

rate_hz.description: The speed of the phaser's low-frequency oscillator (LFO), in Hertz

depth.description: The depth of the phaser effect

centre_frequency_hz.description: The centre frequency of the modulation in Hertz

PitchShift.description: A pitch shifting effect that can change the pitch of audio without affecting its duration. This effect uses Chris Cannam's wonderful Rubber Band audio stretching library.

semitones.description: The number of semitones to shift the pitch by

Reverb.description: A simple reverb effect. Uses a simple stereo reverb algorithm, based on the technique and tunings used in FreeVerb.

room_size.description: Size of the room (higher values create larger, more spacious reverb)

damping.description: High frequency damping (higher values create 'duller' reverb)

dry_level.description: Volume of the original, uneffected signal

width.description: Stereo width of the reverb (1.0 = full stereo, 0.0 = mono)

freeze_mode.description: Freeze mode (when > 0, the reverb freezes and sustains indefinitely)

metadata.description: Audio effects library with comprehensive plugin support
